intro: Sida caulorrhiza, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. Sida caulorrhiza is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
